verses.verse: Thus<WH3541> says<WH559> the Lord,<WH3068> "Go<WH3381> down<WH3381> to the house<WH1004> of the king<WH4428> of Judah,<WH3063> and there<WH8033> speak<WH1696> this<WH2088> word,<WH1697>

and say,<WH559> 'Hear<WH8085> the word<WH1697> of the Lord,<WH3068> O king<WH4428> of Judah,<WH3063> who sits<WH3427> on David's throne,<WH3678> you and your servants<WH5650> and your people<WH5971> who enter<WH935> these<WH428> gates.<WH8179>

'Thus<WH3541> says<WH559> the Lord,<WH3068> "Do<WH6213> justice<WH4941> and righteousness,<WH6666> and deliver<WH5337> the one who has been robbed<WH1497> from the power<WH3027> of [his] oppressor.<WH6216> Also do not mistreat<WH3238> [or] do<WH2554> violence<WH2554> to the stranger,<WH1616> the orphan,<WH3490> or the widow;<WH490> and do not shed<WH8210> innocent<WH9345> blood<WH1818> in this<WH2088> place.<WH4725>

"For if<WH518> you men will indeed<WH6213> perform<WH6213> this<WH2088> thing,<WH1697> then kings<WH4428> will enter<WH935> the gates<WH8179> of this<WH2088> house,<WH1004> sitting<WH3427> in David's place on his throne,<WH3678> riding<WH7392> in chariots<WH7393> and on horses,<WH5483> [even the king] himself<WH1931> and his servants<WH5650> and his people.<WH5971>

"But if<WH518> you will not obey<WH8085> these<WH428> words,<WH1697> I swear<WH7650> by Myself," declares<WH5002> the Lord,<WH3068> "that this<WH2088> house<WH1004> will become<WH1961> a desolation.<WH2723>"' "

For thus<WH3541> says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068> concerning<WH5921> the house<WH1004> of the king<WH4428> of Judah:<WH3063> "You are [like] Gilead<WH1568> to Me, [Like] the summit<WH7218> of Lebanon;<WH3844> Yet most<WH518> <WH3808> assuredly<WH518> <WH3808> I shall make<WH7896> you like a wilderness,<WH4057> [Like] cities<WH5892> which are not inhabited.<WH3427>

"For I shall set<WH6942> apart<WH6942> destroyers<WH7843> against<WH5921> you, Each<WH376> with his weapons;<WH3627> And they will cut<WH3772> down<WH3772> your choicest<WH4005> cedars<WH730> And throw<WH5307> [them] on the fire.<WH784>

"And many<WH7227> nations<WH1471> will pass<WH5674> by this<WH384> city;<WH5892> and they will say<WH559> to one<WH376> another,<WH7453> 'Why<WH5921> <WH4100> has the Lord<WH3068> done<WH6213> thus<WH3602> to this<WH384> great<WH1419> city<WH5892>?'

"Then they will answer,<WH559> 'Because<WH5921> <WH834> they forsook<WH5800> the covenant<WH1285> of the Lord<WH3068> their God<WH430> and bowed<WH7812> down<WH7812> to other<WH312> gods<WH430> and served<WH5647> them.'"

Do not weep<WH1058> for the dead<WH4191> or mourn<WH5110> for him, [But] weep<WH1058> continually<WH1058> for the one who goes<WH1980> away; For he will never<WH3808> <WH5750> return<WH7725> Or see<WH7200> his native<WH4138> land.<WH776>

For thus<WH3541> says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068> in regard<WH413> to Shallum<WH7967> the son<WH1121> of Josiah,<WH2977> king<WH4428> of Judah,<WH3063> who became<WH4427> king<WH4427> in the place<WH8478> of Josiah<WH2977> his father, who<WH1> went<WH834> forth<WH3318> from this<WH3318> place,<WH2088> "He will never<WH4725> <WH3808> return<WH5750> there;<WH7725>
but in the place<WH4725> where<WH834> <WH8033> they led<WH1540> him captive,<WH1540> there<WH8033> he will die<WH4191> and not see<WH7200> this<WH384> land<WH776> again.<WH5750>

"Woe<WH1945> to him who builds<WH1129> his house<WH1004> without<WH3808> righteousness<WH6664> And his upper<WH5944> rooms<WH5944> without<WH3808> justice,<WH4941> Who uses<WH5647> his neighbor's services<WH5647> without<WH2600> pay<WH2600> And does not give<WH5414> him his wages,<WH6467>

Who says,<WH559> 'I will build<WH1129> myself a roomy<WH4060> house<WH1004> With spacious<WH7304> upper<WH5944> rooms,<WH5944> And cut<WH7167> out its windows,<WH2474> Paneling<WH5603> [it] with cedar<WH730> and painting<WH4886> [it] bright<WH8350> red.<WH8350>'

"Do you become<WH4427> a king<WH4427> because<WH3588> you are competing<WH2734> in cedar<WH730>? Did not your father eat<WH1> and drink,<WH398> And do<WH8354> justice<WH6213> and righteousness<WH4941>? Then<WH6666> it was well<WH227> with him.
"He pled<WH1777> the cause<WH1779> of the afflicted<WH6041> and needy;<WH34> Then<WH227> it was well.<WH2895> Is not that what it means to know<WH1847> Me?" Declares<WH5002> the Lord.<WH3068>

"But your eyes<WH5869> and your heart<WH3820> Are [intent] only<WH3588> <WH518> upon your own dishonest<WH1215> gain,<WH1215> And on shedding<WH8210> innocent<WH9345> blood<WH1818> And on practicing<WH6213> oppression<WH6233> and extortion.<WH4835>"

Therefore<WH3651> thus<WH3541> says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068> in regard<WH413> to Jehoiakim<WH3079> the son<WH1121> of Josiah,<WH2977> king<WH4428> of Judah,<WH3063> "They will not lament<WH5594> for him: 'Alas,<WH1945> my brother!<WH251>' or, 'Alas,<WH1945> sister!<WH269>' They will not lament<WH5594> for him: 'Alas<WH1945> for the master!<WH113>' or, 'Alas<WH1945> for his splendor!<WH1935>'
"He will be buried<WH6912> with a donkey's burial,<WH6900> Dragged<WH5498> off and thrown<WH7993> out beyond<WH4480> <WH1973> the gates<WH8179> of Jerusalem.<WH3389>

"Go<WH5927> up to Lebanon<WH3844> and cry<WH6817> out, And lift<WH5414> up your voice<WH6963> in Bashan;<WH1316> Cry<WH6817> out also from Abarim,<WH5682> For all<WH3605> your lovers<WH157> have been crushed.<WH7665>

"I spoke<WH1696> to you in your prosperity;<WH7962> But you said,<WH559> 'I will not listen!<WH8085>' This<WH2088> has been your practice<WH1870> from your youth,<WH5271> That you have not obeyed<WH8085> My voice.<WH6963>

"The wind<WH7307> will sweep<WH7462> away<WH7462> all<WH3605> your shepherds,<WH7462> And your lovers<WH157> will go<WH1980> into captivity;<WH7628> Then<WH227> you will surely<WH3588> be ashamed<WH954> and humiliated<WH3637> Because<WH4480> of all<WH3605> your wickedness.<WH9567>

"You who dwell<WH3427> in Lebanon,<WH3844> Nested<WH7077> in the cedars,<WH730> How<WH4100> you will groan<WH2603> when pangs<WH2256> come<WH935> upon you, Pain<WH2427> like a woman in childbirth!<WH3205>

"As I live,<WH2416>" declares<WH5002> the Lord,<WH3068> "even<WH3588> though<WH518> Coniah<WH3078> the son<WH1121> of Jehoiakim<WH3079> king<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063> were a signet<WH2368> [ring] on My right<WH3225> hand,<WH3027> yet<WH3588> I would pull<WH5423> you off;<WH5423>

and I shall give<WH5414> you over into the hand<WH3027> of those who are seeking<WH1245> your life,<WH5315> yes, into the hand<WH3027> of those whom<WH834> you dread,<WH3016> even into the hand<WH3027> of Nebuchadnezzar<WH5019> king<WH4428> of Babylon,<WH894> and into the hand<WH3027> of the Chaldeans.<WH3778>

"I shall hurl<WH2904> you and your mother<WH517> who<WH834> bore<WH3205> you into another<WH312> country<WH776> where<WH834> <WH8033> you were not born,<WH3205> and there<WH8033> you will die.<WH4191>
"But as for the land<WH776> to which<WH834> they desire<WH5375> <WH5315> to return,<WH7725> they will not return<WH7725> to it.

"Is this<WH2088> man<WH376> Coniah<WH3078> a despised,<WH959> shattered<WH5310> jar<WH9427>? Or<WH518> is he an undesirable<WH369> <WH2656> vessel<WH3627>? Why<WH4069> have he and his descendants<WH2233> been hurled<WH2904> out And cast<WH7993> into a land<WH776> that they had not known<WH3045>?
"O land,<WH776> land,<WH776> land,<WH776> Hear<WH8085> the word<WH1697> of the Lord!<WH3068>

"Thus<WH3541> says<WH559> the Lord,<WH3068> 'Write<WH3789> this<WH2088> man<WH1397> down<WH3789> childless,<WH6185> A man<WH1397> who will not prosper<WH6743> in his days;<WH3117> For no<WH3808> man<WH376> of his descendants<WH2233> will prosper<WH6743> Sitting<WH3427> on the throne<WH3678> of David<WH1732> Or ruling<WH4910> again<WH5750> in Judah.<WH3063>'"
